did.abstract: History honors student and reporter for the Michigan Daily, student newspaper for the University of Michigan. Includes history honors thesis (and background material) "Urban Renewal in Postwar Detroit: The Gratiot Area Redevelopment Plan," material for a mini-course on student activism at Michigan, and material collected for newspaper stories relating to campus issues, especially affirmative action, and the related group, By Any Means Necessary (BAMN). Also material on Michigamua and Vulcans.

bioghist.p: Robert Goodspeed is from Maine and graduated from Greely High School in 2000. He attended the University of Michigan from 2000 to 2004 and graduated with high honors in history. His honors thesis was titled "Urban Renewal in Postwar Detroit: The Gratiot Area Redevelopment Project." He also taught a mini-course in the "History of Student Activism at the University of Michigan" during the winter semester of 2004.

Goodspeed was highly involved while at the University of Michigan serving on student government, writing for The Michigan Daily, and participating in College Democrats and the U of M chapter of the ACLU. He also worked at the Blue Nile Restaurant, served on the Cool Cities Task Force, and founded the Ann Arbor news and civic website ArborUpdate.com.

He currently lives in Washington D.C., editing Dcist.com which is a city-based weblog. Goodspeed also works for the the Internet Coordinator for People For the American Way Foundation's Department of National Programs and Outreach More information about Goodspeed can be found at his frequently updated blog: Goodspeedupdate.com

scopecontent.p: The Goodspeed collection is divided into two series: Academics and Journalism Topics. The collection consists primarily of printouts of reports and e-mail correspondence, flyers for campus events. There are also police reports, decisions from court cases, and material acquired through Freedom of Information (FOIA) requests.

scopecontent.p: The Academics series contains materials related to the Honors program, the course pack for the course on student activism at Michigan taught by Goodspeed in winter 2004, and the final draft of his honors thesis "Urban Renewal in Postwar Detroit: The Gratiot Area Redevelopment Project" and related background materials.

scopecontent.p: The Journalism Topics series contains the source materials for many of Goodspeed's stories for The Michigan Daily. Much of the material was acquired through FOIA requests. Topics range from stories written for the crime beat to investigations of campus secret societies, particularly Michigamua and Vulcans. Stories cover campus and Ann Arbor news. Of note is material on affirmative action and the group BAMN (By Any Means Necessary).
